page.title: 11HOUSING BEULAH - GARTH
page.content: Garth, Council housing, 6 three bed houses in semi-detached pairs, 6 two bed OAP bungalows. These are sheltered housing with call bell for warden in adjacent Council houses. Older houses in both villages mainly owner occupied all have electricity and bathrooms. Houses bought by new-comers to the area are often altered and "improved" and later put up for sale at prices prohibitive for local buyers. New private housing -in last ten years 3 bungalows in Beulah, 2 in Garth (one unfinished.) Farm housing is usually old, but well modernised and tastefully furnished. Only 3 tenant farms in block. No very large houses, usually 3 or 4 bed, and built within last 100 years.
